title: Can I trust Guitar Center to set up my guitar? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would trust the guy working there. The last thing he wants is for someone to go in there saying “ hey you set up my guitar all f-d up !” really loud. He would lose his job. Now if it’s set up a way you don’ t like and you didn’t tell him how you like it set up and just let him do it , then don’ texpect it to be how you like it . It will be how he likes it. This is your fault. You can tell him how you like it, action, low, etc. Worried more about the intonation, etc.

Guitar Center has so many stores, and so many techs. The question isn't if you can trust them. Can you you trust him or her that is doing it? Can you trust anybody that you take it to? They are all paid professionals. There are good and bad ones. That applies to anywhere and anyone.

It all depends upon the skills of the local guitar tech that works for GC. My GC tech is good, and the one before him was good too. Do some due diligence before committing to taking it in for set-up. Setting up an electric guitar is not rocket science. Setting up an acoustic guitar requires some more involved luthier skills.
